Olek the Old was boyar of the Kuloving, the fiercest and most conservative of the Sturgian noble houses. He fell at the battle of Pendraic, leading from the front - as many say Raganvad should have done.
Varra was a noblewoman of the Kuloving. She died under mysterious circumstances the year after the battle
Nimr was a young warrior of the Banu Sarran who led the Aserai contingent at the battle of Pendraic. He was executed by the Banu Qild after seducing a young woman of that clan.

The great Khan Urkhun conquered the eastern frontiers of the Empire and established the Khuzait khanate. Most remember him as a hero, though some resent how he curtailed the ancient liberties of his people to transform them from nomads into lords of a kingdom.
Solun was the chief noyan of the Khergit and the former husband of Mesui, slain at the battle of Pendraic.
Kuyug was the chief noyan of the Arkit clan of the Khuzaits.
Undul was a Khuzait noble of the Arkit clan.

The eastern-central part of the Westlands is ruled by Galldrian su Riatin, who represents a long-standing oligarchic trend in intrigue politics. It holds that the game of houses is the best guarantee that the empire will not become a tyranny. Oligarchs like Galldrian also tend to believe that only landowners can have the extensive education, experience in government, and stake in property to really understand and appreciate the law, and thus the Senate should be supreme.

Caraline is a noblewoman of the House Damodred, a clan noted for their fanatical loyalty to the aristocratic, oligarchic wing of the Senate and their personal eccentricities. Unlike most of the women of the oligarchs, who tend to be conservative, she trained as a warrior. She took some of her family's famed wealth to raise support the rebellion to oppose the Dragon Reborn.

Easer is patriarch of the Togita, one of the oldest of the Shienar clans, which never really accepted the idea of the monarchy. He believes the boyars should be lords in their own lands. He is famed for once telling the prince, 'Every wound I suffer in battle under your banner is like my wife's caress, but every denar I pay to your treasury in tax is like an arrow in my gut.' He is older now, and keeps his counsel, but few believe that his resentment of princely authority has in any way diminished.

Astoril is patriarch of the House Damara, an Tarien house that owns vast estates on the hot plains of the south. The family has traditionally taken the welfare of its tenants seriously, but expects total loyalty from them. He has little to do with the Senate and the politics of the capital.

The heartland of the Westlands is ruled by Elayne, a charismatic Aes Sedai who represents a longstanding populist trend in monarchs joining the White Tower. She is deeply loved by her soldiers, both for her solid record in winning battles and for her insistence that veterans be compensated in land afterwards. She often demands that the 'people' should settle key issues, but in practice this usually means an assembly of soldiers, where veterans can be counted on to shut down opposition.

Luans's family, the house of Norwelyn, has taken charge of andor's northwestern defenses for generations. The clan's leaders are more likely to keep the company of border raiders and scouts than senators in the capital. Luan has backed Elayne's claim to the Lion Throne, largely due to his innate sense of loyalty to a fellow comrade-in-arms.
Mazrim Taim was one of the most power male channelers who declared himself a Dragon reborn. He was instrumental in Rand al'Thor's learning to control his power as his teacher at the Farm.
The small central nation of the Westlands is ruled by Roedran. His biggest challenge has been to unite the squabbling clans into a cohesive kingdom.

The current King of Illian is Mattin. He wears his authority lightly, preferring to charm rather than to coerce, always deferring to the laws of the Council in his judgments. But there are some who say that the Council is remiss in its duty to administer justice, allowing the wealthiest clans - to use bribes and clever legal arguments to oppress the others.

Ethenielle is leader of the House Materasu. Once one of the largest clans in the Kandor confederacy, they suffered many losses during the Trolloc Wars and their lands were subsequently targeted by other tribes. Ethenielle has ruthlessly defended her clan's rights, and frequently complained about the injustices suffered by smaller clans that she says have shed blood for the khanate without reaping any rewards.

The current king of Vlandia is Derthert. In his youth, he dreamt of glorious conquest. In fact he spent most of his reign simply putting down revolts, quashing pretenders, and keeping the fractious barons in line. When possible, he prefers to rule by arbitration, cajoling his vassals to set aside claims to each other's lands and enjoy what they have. But some Vlandians murmur that a warrior people deserve a more virile king.

The current Queen of Saldea is Tenobia, a brilliant war captain who echoes the legendary Zenobia, queen of the Palmyrene Empire. Despite the doubts around her accession, Tenobia has made herself popular among the lesser clans of the land who admire her, for having secured pacts with the other Borderland kingdoms. Her clan is the House Kazadi, a formerly obscure family now swollen with comrades-in-arms for whom she makes strategic marriage alliances.

Alliandre is the Queen of Ghealdan kingdom. She is tolerated by the Crown High Council for her handling of the prophet far better than her predecessors. The Ghealdan have always stood for a strong monarchy, and she is loathe to return the Ghealdan people to the anarchy that consumed them for much of their history.

The current chief of the Aiel is Rhuarc, With the Westerlands in a state of disarray, he dreams of surpassing his ancestor Urkhun and conquering even deeper into the wet lands. Some of the clans have been decimated by the Trolloc wars, however, and feel their sacrifices have not been properly rewarded. They yearn for a chief who is less interested in glory, and more interested in justice.

The current Nae'blis of the Dark One's follower is Ishamael. Harsh and uncompromising, he believes that it is the right of the Nae'blis to command the followers in all things, not just in making war. For the time being they obey him, not least for his ability to call on the power of the Dark One.
Sammael is one of the thirteen Forsaken who was trapped at Shayol Ghul. He was considered one of the worlds greatest generals before his defection to the Dark One.
